DataElement.preferredName: Person Human Immunodeficiency Virus Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person is positive for Human Immunodeficiency Virus, a cytopathic retrovirus, and being treated with antiretroviral therapy, drug therapy which targets retrovirus function, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial._the yes/no indicator related to the patient's eligibility to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Human Immunodeficiency Virus Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person being positive for Human Immunodeficiency Virus, a cytopathic retrovirus, and being treated with antiretroviral therapy, drug therapy which targets retrovirus function, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:Drug therapy which targets retrovirus function by multiple mechanisms.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
Drug therapy which targets retrovirus function by multiple mechanisms.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient HIV positive o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV positive on combination antiretroviral therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV positive and on combination antiretroviral therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient known to be HIV positive with a baseline CD4 count of <250 cells/mm3 or have a history of AIDS indicator conditions

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV positive AND on combination antiretroviral therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require antiretroviral therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: maintained on stable antiretroviral therapy with no significant drug interactions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Must be stable on their anti-retroviral regimen, and they must be healthy from an HIV prespective

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV positive and under treatment with highly active antiretroviral therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient is stable on their anti-retroviral regimen, and is healthy from an HIV perspective.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on a stable highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) regimen with no drug-drug interaction with UGT1A9?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Within 4 weeks prior to randomization was the patient on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy HAART?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known HIV positive status

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV positive (on effective anti-retroviral therapy) with a detectable viral load within 6 months and have a CD4 count less than 200 cells/microliter within 60 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on effective anti-retroviral therapy with undetectable viral load within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HIV infected on effective anti retroviral therapy with an undetectable viral load within 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient  HIV infected (on effective anti-retroviral therapy) with detectable viral load within 6 months prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is an HIV-infected patient on an effective anti-retroviral therapy with an undetectable viral load within 6 months, is the patient receiving strong anti-retroviral inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, CYP2D6, and/or MRP2 transporter protein?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
